_header: Some fastens fast for forty year
Subjects: knights, behavior of; Arthur, king; Arthurian literature; Gawain, stories of
_description: Fragment of an ubi sunt poem in praise of Arthur, Gawain, Alexander, etc. — three quatrains

BosPLMed94.Transcription:
Sum festynnys fast for forti ȝerNoȝt [f?]estis noȝth
                    for xthis fundament makis for euermorIn wane vyrcis his peneAs it
                    var endles eritagisÞat oþer man meȝt keneBot oft it
                    gays fra hym & hisTyll oþer kynd of menVith ane M bot and
                    OQuhar is wawane þe wethtArthowr schort & allexanderWith
                    mekyll wek of meȝt
BosPLMed94.Note:
Very faint; preceded by line, ‘how suld my febill beye feth’
                    and then signature (between this line and beginning, ‘Thom. Swyntoun With
                    my hand fyny[shed]’ (f. i).
